programme.review: IMDb data; ttnr: 10108664, Title: The Disappearance of Susan Cox Powell, --- Description: The Disappearance of Susan Cox Powell: With Stephanie Bauer, Jennifer Graves, Josh Skurnik, Kirk Graves. Susan Powell was just 28 years-old when she vanished from her suburban home in West Valley City, Utah in 2009." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt10108664/","name":"The Disappearance of Susan Cox Powell","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWJjNWE4MTQtOWE2NS00ZWJiLWJjNDUtNjI5Y2NmMDI2MDdhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzk1MzU0MzQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"Susan Powell was just 28 years-old when she vanished from her suburban home in West Valley City, Utah in 2009.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10108664/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"rdoubleoc","dateCreated":"2019-05-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"Oxygen at it's finest.","reviewBody":"I had never heard of this case before now, but have watched a lot of Oxygen's real-life crime shows, and this one was just as good.\n\nThey do a really good job of showing the whole picture (the thing news articles don't really do a good job of). Instead of reading countless news articles on the subject, it's better to just wait for Oxygen to do their job and make few-hour documentary on the topic, and then watch that.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":660,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1,"genre":["Documentary","Crime"],"datePublished":"2019-05-04","keywords":"tv mini series","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7394227/","name":"Stephanie Bauer","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6679645/","name":"Jennifer Graves","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8625825/","name":"Josh Skurnik"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0538933/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0463370/"]</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Szczescie swiata: Directed by Michal Rosa. With Karolina Gruszka, Mateusz Lickindorf, Grzegorz Palkowski, Dariusz Chojnacki. A journalist from Warsaw travels to Silesia and manages to find a tenement house full of exceptional inhabitants." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6104188/","name":"Szczescie swiata","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDQ3OTUzZWYtYTFlNi00Y2FhLWFmMDEtMGNkOGU2OTZlYWVjL2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTc4MzI2NQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A journalist from Warsaw travels to Silesia and manages to find a tenement house full of exceptional inhabitants.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6104188/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kosmasp"},"dateCreated":"2021-08-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"Life of others","reviewBody":"World War 2 .. or rather the behind the scenes of everyday life before the mayhem started. Sort of - and with a lot of different individuals and characters to keep us occupied. Many scenes and a lot of German (original language of the movie is polish) being spoken too. Which makes sense of course and I didn't mind, understanding it all.\n\nStories are decent enough and you will care about most people/individuals overall. Drama is there and some will cherish how this was made more than others. It is very well made for sure, the acting is good too. I understand if some rate it higher just because they feel this deserves more than it currently has here on imdb. On the other hand some others will be bored .. because pacing wise it won't be for everyone.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":127,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8},"genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2016-12-23","keywords":"silesia,bathtub,femme fatale","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0344734/","name":"Karolina Gruszka"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8475166/","name":"Mateusz Lickindorf"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2707614/","name":"Grzegorz Palkowski"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0740853/","name":"Michal Rosa"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0330220/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049230/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0577510/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0740853/","name":"Michal Rosa"}],"duration":"PT1H38M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Hi, How Are You
programme.desc: Bezrobotny pięćdziesięcioletni Sławek (Jacek Poniedziałek) ma problem z zabiciem wolnego czasu. Mężczyzna przesiaduje w domu bądź włóczy się po osiedlu, szukając zaginionego kota. W najlepszym razie wykonuje różnego rodzaju prace zlecone mu przez żonę. Pewnego dnia Sławek poznaje tajemniczą sąsiadkę Kamilę (Maja Szopa). Kobieta zaprasza go do swojego ogrodu.

programme.title: Jestem tutaj
programme.desc: Niespodziewany przyjazd młodszego brata Stefana (Miłosz Frydrychowicz) zmusza dwudziestoletnią Hanię (Marianna Kowalewska) do zmierzenia się z trudną przeszłością i do odnowy kontaktu z dawno niewidzianą matką. Przez wzgląd na chłopaka dziewczyna musi dać szansę tej skomplikowanej relacji.

programme.title: Psychobitch
Psycholka
Psychobitch
programme.desc:
Psychobitch: Directed by Martin Lund. With Jonas Tidemann, Elli Rhiannon Müller Osborne, Saara Sipila-Kristoffersen, Bethina Nærby. Frida is different. Marius, on the other hand is the most perfect boy in class. When they have to work together at school, it's the start of a turbulent and challenging relationship. Generation Achievement meets impossible love." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8360266/","name":"Psychobitch","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjdiYzc2ZjctOWNiNS00OWQ2LWE4ZjktNmY4YjVmZGE5N2RhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTc5OTQwMzk@._V1_.jpg","description":"Frida is different. Marius, on the other hand is the most perfect boy in class. When they have to work together at school, it's the start of a turbulent and challenging relationship. Generation Achievement meets impossible love.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8360266/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"beormas"},"dateCreated":"2020-01-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Unusual teen romance","reviewBody":"Marius is a good boy. He's good in school, he always does what he's told and what's expected of him. We as the audience are never exactly told if he's happy with that, but we suspect that he's not. In comes Frida, the new girl in school who, rumour has it, had tried to commit suicide. She's the exact opposite, she never does what she's told and shows some very rude behaviour. For a class project, a techer asks Marius to team up with Frida and although he's not thrilled, he can't say no., so he awkwardly tries to engage with Frida. Being strong-willed, Frida plays with Marius and makes him do things that are completely against his nature, even things that are forbidden. Not to spoil anything, you can guess that a teen romance eventlually leads to them falling in love, not without complications like the girl Marius used to date before he met Frida.

The core message of the movie is that our society wishes for children to be like Marius, but in order to be happy they need to develop their own character and do what makes them happy, even if it doesn't always make their parents happy.

My main criticism is that both the characters of Marius and Frida were too extreme to be entirely credible, Marius too boring and Frida too impulsive, but I guess the director wanted it this way to drive home the "opposites attract" thing. My teenager days are long gone, but still I found the movie entertaining, the acting was solid and while I wouldn't pay to see it in a cinema, the time watching it on tv was not wasted. Frida is different. Marius, on the other hand is the most perfect boy in class. When they have to work together at school, it's the start of a turbulent and challenging relationship. Generation Achievement meets impossible love." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8360266/","name":"Psychobitch","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjdiYzc2ZjctOWNiNS00OWQ2LWE4ZjktNmY4YjVmZGE5N2RhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTc5OTQwMzk@._V1_.jpg","description":"Frida is different. Marius, on the other hand is the most perfect boy in class. When they have to work together at school, it's the start of a turbulent and challenging relationship. Generation Achievement meets impossible love.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8360266/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"beormas","dateCreated":"2020-01-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Unusual teen romance","reviewBody":"Marius is a good boy. He's good in school, he always does what he's told and what's expected of him. We as the audience are never exactly told if he's happy with that, but we suspect that he's not. In comes Frida, the new girl in school who, rumour has it, had tried to commit suicide. She's the exact opposite, she never does what she's told and shows some very rude behaviour. For a class project, a techer asks Marius to team up with Frida and although he's not thrilled, he can't say no., so he awkwardly tries to engage with Frida. Being strong-willed, Frida plays with Marius and makes him do things that are completely against his nature, even things that are forbidden. Not to spoil anything, you can guess that a teen romance eventlually leads to them falling in love, not without complications like the girl Marius used to date before he met Frida.

The core message of the movie is that our society wishes for children to be like Marius, but in order to be happy they need to develop their own character and do what makes them happy, even if it doesn't always make their parents happy.

My main criticism is that both the characters of Marius and Frida were too extreme to be entirely credible, Marius too boring and Frida too impulsive, but I guess the director wanted it this way to drive home the "opposites attract" thing. My teenager days are long gone, but still I found the movie entertaining, the acting was solid and while I wouldn't pay to see it in a cinema, the time watching it on tv was not wasted. Of course the movie is aimed at teenagers and parents with teenage children.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":846,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9,"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-01-11","keywords":"one word title,teenage boy,teenage girl,coming of age,small town","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6638989/","name":"Jonas Tidemann","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9602953/","name":"Elli Rhiannon Müller Osborne","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9811535/","name":"Saara Sipila-Kristoffersen"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1814880/","name":"Martin Lund"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0291647/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0780832/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054056/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1814880/","name":"Martin Lund"],"duration":"PT1H49M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Coco avant Chanel
Coco Chanel
Coco avant Chanel
programme.desc:
Coco avant Chanel: Directed by Anne Fontaine. With Audrey Tautou, Benoît Poelvoorde, Alessandro Nivola, Marie Gillain. The story of Coco Chanel's rise from obscure beginnings to the heights of the fashion world." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1035736/","name":"Coco avant Chanel","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTA0NjYzMzQxNzBeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU3MDI2MDA0ODI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story of Coco Chanel's rise from obscure beginnings to the heights of the fashion world.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1035736/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ahifi"},"dateCreated":"2009-07-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Does what it says...","reviewBody":"Coco avant Chanel focuses, quite literally, on the roots of Coco before the whole Chanel business.

I noted the movie seemed to frustrate those with no grasp of the French language at all. Many seemed to go in unaware that the movie was set before her 'Chanel' days and I couldn't help but feel a sense of disappointment at the end from others; via looking at their faces, overhearing conversations and talking with friends. It's interesting, but it does plod on very slowly.

We are treated to a very rude, harsh character in Coco. Full credit goes to Audrey Tautou for her performance though. She really does fit into this movie's feel and tone very well. Her cheeky performance is definitely a highlight.

I don't know what to make of Alessandro Nivola as 'Boy'. The character was and looked rather sleazy. I'm not sure if that was meant or if that was Alessandro. Other than that, mentions go to Benoît Poelvoorde for his solid performance and Emmanuelle Devos as the sexy and self-assured Emilienne d'Alençon.

Other than that, it's a solid biopic. 7/10","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":39900,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Biography","Drama"],"datePublished":"2009-04-22","keywords":"life of celebrity before becoming famous,social status,1920s,beach,wealth","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2992290329","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTY0ODg1MTUtODNmNC00ZDUzLWI3YzEtNWU1OGM2ODNiZmQ2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTY0ODg1MTUtODNmNC00ZDUzLWI3YzEtNWU1OGM2ODNiZmQ2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0851582/","name":"Audrey Tautou"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0688143/","name":"Benoît Poelvoorde"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005273/","name":"Alessandro Nivola"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0284774/","name":"Anne Fontaine"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030799/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0254563/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1212643/","name":"Edmonde Charles-Roux"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0284774/","name":"Anne Fontaine"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1597664/","name":"Camille Fontaine"}],"duration":"PT1H45M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Rykoszety
programme.desc: Polska, 1982 rok. Nastroje społeczne stają się coraz bardziej napięte. Dwóch braci, będących górnikami, ma odmienne zdanie dotyczące postawy, jaką należy przyjąć w obliczu komunistycznego systemu. Janek (Stanisław Linowski) angażuje się w działania podziemia na rzecz demokracji. Tadek (Tomasz Schuchardt) natomiast woli zachować neutralność. Między mężczyznami pogłębia się konflikt.

programme.title: Utrata
programme.desc: Każdy z członków rodziny na swój sposób próbuje sobie poradzić ze stratą. Nastoletni Piotrek stara się, żeby jego młodszy brat nie odczuwał pustki. Osamotniony, stopniowo traci siłę, aby mierzyć się z codziennością.

programme.title: Le jeune Ahmed
Młody Ahmed
Le jeune Ahmed
programme.desc:
Le jeune Ahmed: Directed by Jean-Pierre Dardenne, Luc Dardenne. With Idir Ben Addi, Olivier Bonnaud, Myriem Akheddiou, Victoria Bluck. A Belgian teenager hatches a plot to kill his teacher after embracing an extremist interpretation of the Quran." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8359822/","name":"Le jeune Ahmed","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmJiNzMzYWQtZmQ1OC00ZDlkLTljNTktMmMxM2JlNzA3NmZhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjI3NDAyNg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A Belgian teenager hatches a plot to kill his teacher after embracing an extremist interpretation of the Quran.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8359822/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"howard.schumann"},"dateCreated":"2019-10-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"A thought-provoking and involving experience","reviewBody":"Over the last twenty years, the Dardenne brothers' ("The Unknown Girl") social realist dramas about the forgotten and the marginalized have been honored at the Cannes Film Festival with two Palme d'Ors, two Best Performance awards, one Best Screenplay award, and one Grand Prix. Their magic is still in evidence in their latest film, Young Ahmed, which won them the award for Best Director this year at Cannes. While it is a small film on a very big subject - that of Islamic fundamentalism - the film manages to deliver a thought-provoking and involving experience in spite of its 84-minute length and the broad scope of its subject.

Set in a small town in Belgium, a country that has endured recent terrorist attacks, the film belongs to first-time actor Idir Ben Addi who delivers a remarkable performance as Ahmed, a studious-looking, bespectacled 13-year-old boy whose hangdog appearance and inarticulateness masks his devotion to a fundamentalist religious philosophy that takes no prisoners. With his youth and malleability, his growing adherence to what he considers to be a true Muslim is fostered by his relationship with a local imam, Youssouf (Othmane Moumen, "Bad Buzz") who rails at what he considers to be the growing secular attack on Islam.

Without a father in the home to guide him, Ahmed personifies those whose obsession with ideology blinds them to their own humanity and that of others, taking on the imam's "us versus them" attitude even when it comes to his family. He calls his sister a "slut" because of the casual way she dresses and berates his mother (Claire Bodson, "Our Children") for drinking wine and not wearing a hijab. Apparently, Ahmed's transformation is recent since his mother laments the fact that just last year all he thought about were video games, but we do not know what triggered Ahmed's transformation and the film does not pursue it.

We do know, however, that he is burdened by the memory of his cousin who apparently took his own life as a suicide bomber, a fact that the imam will not let him forget. The teenager's main source of conflict is with his teacher Inès (Myriem Akheddiou, "The Kid with a Bike"). He refuses to shake her hand because he thinks women are impure and because she is dating a person of the Jewish faith. He is also upset about her plans to use music to teach Arabic and the Quran, plans that he considers sacrilegious. Labeled by the imam as an apostate, the impressionable teenager tries to prove his faith by physically assaulting her, an action for which he is placed in juvenile custody. Even this is too much for the imam who tells Ahmed that he said to oppose her beliefs, not try to kill her.

At the juvenile facility, Ahmed is treated with respect by his caseworker, psychologist, and teachers, but the viewer is left probing for clues as to whether Ahmed regrets his actions and is willing to change or whether he is quietly planning another assault. As part of his rehabilitation, he is sent to a farm where he is befriended by Louise (Victoria Bluck), the young daughter at the farm, but even her kiss does not awaken in him a feeling for people who have a different outlook on life. While Young Ahmed centers on the fundamentalist tenets of one religion, the film is not an attack on Islam but an assertion that any idea which considers itself to be the only true belief is antithetical to long-established ideals of tolerance and religious freedom.

Ultimately, no words or actions of others seem to reach Ahmed. As director Jean-Pierre Dardenne put it, "Fanatics don't listen to the outside world; they build a wall between themselves and the world. Their only goal is for others to become like them, no matter the cost." Though the direction in which Ahmed is headed is unclear, it is in the moment when his body deserts him that we get a hint he knows that his only escape from the bondage of ideology is to discover the true nature of his own being and that his only loss will be that which has stood in the way of his deeper understanding of the world.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3761,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-05-22","keywords":"classroom,muslim,imam,teacher,mother son relationship","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi452115481","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2RiNjYyN2MtNTdhOC00MmQxLWIwYmItNzE1YjkyMjkxYTk0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2RiNjYyN2MtNTdhOC00MmQxLWIwYmItNzE1YjkyMjkxYTk0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm10712072/","name":"Idir Ben Addi"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5672971/","name":"Olivier Bonnaud"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4159235/","name":"Myriem Akheddiou"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0201094/","name":"Jean-Pierre Dardenne"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0201095/","name":"Luc Dardenne"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0075922/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0016569/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0056755/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0201094/","name":"Jean-Pierre Dardenne"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0201095/","name":"Luc Dardenne"}],"duration":"PT1H25M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Echo
programme.desc: Kinga (Anna Bieżyńska) jest młodą kobietą, której udało się pokonać ciężką chorobę. Po jej przebyciu stara się na nowo odnaleźć w świecie. Okazuje się to trudne. Dziewczyna ma koszmary. Również jej relacje z chłopakiem, choć z pozoru dobre, są raczej oziębłe. Do Kingi długo nie dociera fakt, że coś jej dolega. Tymczasem koszmary stopniowo przeradzają się w widzenia na jawie. Rzeczywistość zlewa się ze snami. W końcu trudno jest Kindze ocenić, co dzieje się naprawdę.

programme.title: Szukając Ingmara Bergmana
programme.desc: Sylwetka legendy kina i teatru. Margarethe von Trotta opowiada o dokonaniach szwedzkiego reżysera Ingmara Bergmana. Wnikliwie analizuje najważniejsze sceny z jego filmów, a także kluczowe wątki powtarzające się w całej twórczości autora dramatu "Siódma pieczęć". Von Trotta odnosi się także do miejsc ważnych dla biografii reżysera. W filmie głos zabierają również współpracownicy szwedzkiego mistrza oraz młodsze pokolenie filmowców, dla których dokonania Bergmana są stałym źródłem inspiracji.

programme.title: The Kindergarten Teacher
Przedszkolanka
The Kindergarten Teacher
programme.desc: The Kindergarten Teacher: Directed by Sara Colangelo. With Maggie Gyllenhaal, Gael García Bernal, Ato Blankson-Wood, Libya Pugh. A kindergarten teacher in New York becomes obsessed with one of her students whom she believes is a child prodigy." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6952960/","name":"The Kindergarten Teacher","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDIxNjIwNjktZTQzNS00ODI1LTkyZGItNDhkYjJlM2FhODcyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxODk2OTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"A kindergarten teacher in New York becomes obsessed with one of her students whom she believes is a child prodigy.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6952960/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"michelle6620"},"dateCreated":"2018-10-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"A little slow but worth it...","reviewBody":"I watched this because I'm a big Maggie Gyllenhaal fan. I have never been disappointed in anything that she is in. When I saw her promoting this film I just had to see it. I will admit I was ready to give up on the movie after the first 20 minutes but I'm glad I didn't. It is a slow burn as you learn more about this Kindergarten teacher's private life and the nurturing relationship she has with her student. The teacher thinks she has a little Mozart on her hands and this child basically becomes an obsession of hers. This story really stirred a variety of emotions within me. Although my sons are adults now, I couldn't help thinking how I would have felt in a similar situation. A kindergarten teacher in New York becomes obsessed with one of her students whom she believes is a child prodigy." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6952960/","name":"The Kindergarten Teacher","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDIxNjIwNjktZTQzNS00ODI1LTkyZGItNDhkYjJlM2FhODcyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxODk2OTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"A kindergarten teacher in New York becomes obsessed with one of her students whom she believes is a child prodigy.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6952960/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"michelle6620","dateCreated":"2018-10-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"A little slow but worth it...","reviewBody":"I watched this because I'm a big Maggie Gyllenhaal fan. I have never been disappointed in anything that she is in. When I saw her promoting this film I just had to see it. I will admit I was ready to give up on the movie after the first 20 minutes but I'm glad I didn't. It is a slow burn as you learn more about this Kindergarten teacher's private life and the nurturing relationship she has with her student. The teacher thinks she has a little Mozart on her hands and this child basically becomes an obsession of hers. This story really stirred a variety of emotions within me. Although my sons are adults now, I couldn't help thinking how I would have felt in a similar situation. This was very well written and Maggie Gyllenhaal's superb acting should earn her an Oscar nomination.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":14632,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2018-10-11","keywords":"title directed by female,topless female nudity,f rated,kindergarten,new york city","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi857914137","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWMwYzcyMDEtMDM3MC00YTk4LWEwMGEtNzE3ODBkMDA2ZDU1XkEyXkFqcGdeQWtlbGFyc2Vu._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWMwYzcyMDEtMDM3MC00YTk4LWEwMGEtNzE3ODBkMDA2ZDU1XkEyXkFqcGdeQWtlbGFyc2Vu._V1_.jpg","description":"A kindergarten teacher in New York becomes obsessed with one of her students who she believes is a child prodigy.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0350454/","name":"Maggie Gyllenhaal","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0305558/","name":"Gael García Bernal","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3492635/","name":"Ato Blankson-Wood"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2528690/","name":"Sara Colangelo"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0220084/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0635366/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0605165/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2528690/","name":"Sara Colangelo","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2028715/","name":"Nadav Lapid"],"duration":"PT1H36M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Enfant Terrible
Enfant Terrible
programme.desc:
Enfant Terrible: Directed by Oskar Roehler. With Oliver Masucci, Hary Prinz, Katja Riemann, Felix Hellmann. The life and the impact of iconic German New Wave director, Rainer Werner Fassbinder." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10855798/","name":"Enfant Terrible","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY4MjJiZDYtNjNlNS00NTE3LWIzZWEtMmNkMTJkYzg5OGYzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjUxMzg2Mzk@._V1_.jpg","description":"The life and the impact of iconic German New Wave director, Rainer Werner Fassbinder.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10855798/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"panta-4"},"dateCreated":"2021-05-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"Biopic for the master which never reaches the hights!","reviewBody":"Well, this time I got the right "Enfant Terrible" film, not that atrocity of the film art called "L'Enfant Terrible"... so I could enjoy the story of one of my favorite directors - Rainer Werner Fassbinder.

I watched and enjoyed many of his movies but I wasn't really aware how screwed his life was! Oskar Roehler delivered a realistically portrayed biography of Rainer Werner Fassbinder - a kind of political manifesto intertwined with subject's personal life! It was done so well, that I could fully immerse into the weirdness, awkwardness and sickness of the guy who was a real genius, but lasted only 36 years on this Earth because could not control his urge for the self-destruction!

Difficult to watch but always fascinating with very interesting directing choices!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":578,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6},"contentRating":"Unrated","genre":["Biography","Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-10-01","keywords":"foreign language title,munich germany,film director,film producer,1970s","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1748352537","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGEwZDEzYTEtNWY4Ni00NTc3LWI5OGItZWJkMjNmYjI1MDJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGEwZDEzYTEtNWY4Ni00NTc3LWI5OGItZWJkMjNmYjI1MDJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A biopic on the life and the impact of iconic German New Wave director, Rainer Werner Fassbinder."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0557908/","name":"Oliver Masucci"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0697890/","name":"Hary Prinz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0726257/","name":"Katja Riemann"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0753912/","name":"Oskar Roehler"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0164664/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0202503/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0051615/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0725305/","name":"Klaus Richter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0753912/","name":"Oskar Roehler"}],"duration":"PT2H14M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Berlin Alexanderplatz
Berlin Alexanderplatz
programme.desc: Berlin Alexanderplatz: Directed by Burhan Qurbani. With Welket Bungué, Albrecht Schuch, Jella Haase, Annabelle Mandeng. A man from Guinea-Bissau moves to Germany, where he is befriended by a drug dealer and two women." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6470924/","name":"Berlin Alexanderplatz","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDI2YWRjZWYtNmYwNS00YWM5LTg0YjEtMGRmMjQ3M2NlYzUyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjI3NDAyNg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A man from Guinea-Bissau moves to Germany, where he is befriended by a drug dealer and two women.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6470924/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"guilhermea-56807"},"dateCreated":"2020-07-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Almost a good film","reviewBody":"This film had everything to work. It's loosely based on a good novel, the initial premise sounds good, a refugee looking for redemption is corrupted by his environment in Berlin, the cinematography is amazing (not often the case in German cinema), editing is good, I loved the sets too. Regarding the acting, there were some great moments but it looked inconsistent, in the end I believe the actors did a great job with the poor screenplay provided to them. The story just doesn't work. The relationships between characters are not credibel, they are born out of nowhere, out of nothing, there is no tension there, there is no development in those relationships and it made me not understand nor care about them (all the relationships of the main character, they make no sense to me). Also that villain, it was actually a well written psycopath, but at some point I bet someone fell in love with the cool character they were writing and he started taking way too much space on the story. In the end it's almost a good movie, but it doesn't really reach that level.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2928,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"genre":["Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-07-16","keywords":"gay interest,man burned alive,adaptation,chapters,epilogue","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3360735001","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWFmZjc1NjQtNTNhNC00YWE4LWEyMDYtZTFkYTFkNTJmOGI1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWFmZjc1NjQtNTNhNC00YWE4LWEyMDYtZTFkYTFkNTJmOGI1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2993505/","name":"Welket Bungué"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3477129/","name":"Albrecht Schuch"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3436464/","name":"Jella Haase"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2546059/","name":"Burhan Qurbani"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0248277/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050481/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0014456/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2935195/","name":"Martin Behnke"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0246841/","name":"Alfred Döblin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2546059/","name":"Burhan Qurbani"}],"duration":"PT3H3M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Girl
Ziemia jałowa
The Rise
programme.desc: The Girl: Directed by Julian Jarrold. With Sienna Miller, Toby Jones, Imelda Staunton, Conrad Kemp. The turbulent relationship between filmmaker Sir Alfred Hitchcock (Toby Jones) and actress Tippi Hedren (Sienna Miller)." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2132485/","name":"The Girl","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTc0NzA4MDU3OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTE2Mzg1OA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The turbulent relationship between filmmaker Sir Alfred Hitchcock (Toby Jones) and actress Tippi Hedren (Sienna Miller).","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2132485/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Cinetech"},"dateCreated":"2012-11-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"An important note about this film.....","reviewBody":"Probably all of this film is a complete lie, but in all of the reviews both internal and external, the critics have overlooked an amazing thing that seems to have gone unnoticed by most....The actor portraying Hitchcock is wearing flawless silicone gel filled prosthetics over almost every inch of his face and neck...he doesn't look exactly like Hitchcock, but the prosthetics are blended flawlessly and are truly believable. The film itself is completely ridiculous, and anyone who would believe that Tippi Hedren was actually being tortured by birds in take after take is either very simple minded or has no idea as to the way films are actually made...Tippi Hedren was a lukewarm actress who was angry that she could never get work after these films and has convinced herself that it must have been Hitch who was behind her failure, when it was actually the simple fact that she wasn't very good at all."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":6854,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Biography","Drama"],"datePublished":"2012-10-20","keywords":"bird,model,blonde,director,actress","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1092227/","name":"Sienna Miller"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0429363/","name":"Toby Jones"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001767/","name":"Imelda Staunton"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0418982/","name":"Julian Jarrold"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0176427/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0044704/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0400634/","name":"Gwyneth Hughes"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0819488/","name":"Donald Spoto"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 2132485, Title: The Girl, --- Description: The Girl: Directed by Julian Jarrold. With Sienna Miller, Toby Jones, Imelda Staunton, Conrad Kemp. The turbulent relationship between filmmaker Sir Alfred Hitchcock (Toby Jones) and actress Tippi Hedren (Sienna Miller)." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2132485/","name":"The Girl","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTc0NzA4MDU3OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTE2Mzg1OA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The turbulent relationship between filmmaker Sir Alfred Hitchcock (Toby Jones) and actress Tippi Hedren (Sienna Miller).","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2132485/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Cinetech","dateCreated":"2012-11-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"An important note about this film.....","reviewBody":"Probably all of this film is a complete lie, but in all of the reviews both internal and external, the critics have overlooked an amazing thing that seems to have gone unnoticed by most....The actor portraying Hitchcock is wearing flawless silicone gel filled prosthetics over almost every inch of his face and neck...he doesn't look exactly like Hitchcock, but the prosthetics are blended flawlessly and are truly believable. The film itself is completely ridiculous, and anyone who would believe that Tippi Hedren was actually being tortured by birds in take after take is either very simple minded or has no idea as to the way films are actually made...Tippi Hedren was a lukewarm actress who was angry that she could never get work after these films and has convinced herself that it must have been Hitch who was behind her failure, when it was actually the simple fact that she wasn't very good at all.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":6854,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Biography","Drama"],"datePublished":"2012-10-20","keywords":"bird,model,blonde,director,actress","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1092227/","name":"Sienna Miller","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0429363/","name":"Toby Jones","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001767/","name":"Imelda Staunton"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0418982/","name":"Julian Jarrold"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0176427/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0044704/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0400634/","name":"Gwyneth Hughes","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0819488/","name":"Donald Spoto"],"duration":"PT1H31M"</script><metacontent="

War correspondent Roger East and the young Jose Ramos-Horta travel to East Timor to investigate the murders of the Balibo Five in 1975." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1111876/","name":"Balibo","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTMzMzE3MjkwNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjE0ODEwNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"War correspondent Roger East and the young Jose Ramos-Horta travel to East Timor to investigate the murders of the Balibo Five in 1975.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1111876/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"uncledoza"},"dateCreated":"2009-08-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"The best non-comedy Australian Film I have seen","reviewBody":"Born a decade on from the events depicted in this film I new little of the story of the occupation and take over of then Portuguese Timor , even though I was avid History student in school. By the end of this film my eyes were well an truly open. 

This movie left with so many conflicting emotions. Angered with brutality and senselessness of human violence and cold cruelty towards other beings, mixed with the marvel of a truly well told film. Brilliant acting, with a pace that never seems to linger despite the seriousness of the topic.

Truly worth the price of admission

programme.title: Outpost: Rise of the Spetsnaz
Outpost: Front wschodni
Outpost: Rise of the Spetsnaz
programme.desc: Outpost: Rise of the Spetsnaz: Directed by Kieran Parker. With Bryan Larkin, Iván Kamarás, Velibor Topic, Laurentiu Possa. In this third installment of the hit Nazi Zombie action horror movie, Outpost: Rise Of The Spetnaz, we discover the horrifying origins of these supernatural soldiers and see them in ferocious gladiatorial battle against the most ruthless and notorious of all military special forces: the Russian Spetsnaz." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2241403/","name":"Outpost: Rise of the Spetsnaz","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM4NzAwODEwNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTMwNTQ2OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In this third installment of the hit Nazi Zombie action horror movie, Outpost: Rise Of The Spetnaz, we discover the horrifying origins of these supernatural soldiers and see them in ferocious gladiatorial battle against the most ruth","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2241403/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"hobgoblinlol"},"dateCreated":"2013-11-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"Enjoyable","reviewBody":"Honestly, don't know why it got 4.2 in my opinion the movie at least deserves 5.0-6.0 yes it is a cheesy sci-fi plot, but I think it is well executed. The thing I love about Outpost movies is the atmosphere and even though I think that the film took an odd turn by going back to WW2 to have an origin story it was still well done. But we can all see that the budget of the movie isn't completely as good as the first Outpost. The acting is decent and the action is good. Plot and the story maybe little bit too cheesy, but it's a Nazi zombie sci-fi flick so what do you expect? god father? I'm actually surprised with the stern treatment Outpost movies receive. Not to mention when people call ''Dead Snow'' good it's just eerie. Even Frankenstein's army has 5.0 than this considering the fact that it is not as good. War of the dead has 4.0 even though it's not an awful disaster. This one actually had some cameos and references from the previous films including the Beethoven song that starts randomly playing once in a while in all three films (very good touch in my opinion) as far as I am concerned the movie is definitely a 5.0 - 6.0/10. It wouldn't hurt to let the logic fly out and enjoy a cheesy flick that can grant you certain entertainment.\n\nIMDb and Rotten Tomatoes logic: if it's not a masterpiece, it's bad. Even though IMDb is a saint compared to Rotten Tomatoes. Hopefully, when more people vote it'll at least get the rating of 5.0","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2276,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.1},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Action","Horror","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2013-06-27","keywords":"zombie,underground facility,escape,prisoner,ss officer","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1385922/","name":"Bryan Larkin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0436442/","name":"Iván Kamarás"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0867677/","name":"Velibor Topic"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0662404/","name":"Kieran Parker"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0197375/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0428412/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2361978/","name":"Rae Brunton"}],"duration":"PT1H27M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Britannic
Britannic
programme.desc: Britannic: Directed by Brian Trenchard-Smith. With Edward Atterton, Amanda Ryan, Jacqueline Bisset, Ben Daniels. A fictional account of the sinking of the H.M.H.S. Britannic off the Greek island of Kea in November 1916. This explores the theory of a German Agent sabotaging the liner, a hospital ship." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0190281/","name":"Britannic","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQzMzE0MDI0Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTU0ODEzMQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A fictional account of the sinking of the H.M.H.S. Britannic off the Greek island of Kea in November 1916. This explores the theory of a German Agent sabotaging the liner, a hospital ship.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0190281/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Jack the Ripper1888"},"dateCreated":"2002-09-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not half as good as TITANIC, but still somewhat entertaining.","reviewBody":"The latter TITANIC was not the epic film about the perilous disaster that the ship beheld when it crashed into an iceberg. No, TITANIC was a mediocre love story written around the ship's disaster. And, this film made the pathetic mistake a few years ago, to try and rip off the success of that first movie with making a TV "special" about the tragic journey of Titanic's sister ship (this TV special also included about a zillion commercials).\n\n The characters are even less interesting than they were in TITANIC, and the special effects and camerawork and not nearly as good. And this is not a good thing, especially since the producers obviously made sure that everyone knew this film was coming, so that they would watch it. And when it finally arrives, it is a complete and total flop. This did not keep me from buying again for my video collection when I saw it at Hollywood for under five dollars. All together, the storyline is slightly more interesting, as there are several gunfights and thrilling moments in which people are chased around. The film is not the thriller that it says it is. It is just another average film based on your true story (with the facts altered of course) and tries to rip off of the success of its predecessor. BRITANNIC gets 2/5."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1330,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.2},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Drama","History"],"datePublished":"2000-01-10","keywords":"kea,tzia,keos,greek cyclades,aegean","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0041029/","name":"Edward Atterton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0752406/","name":"Amanda Ryan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000302/","name":"Jacqueline Bisset"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0872062/","name":"Brian Trenchard-Smith"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0063686/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0015207/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0859920/","name":"Brett Thompson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0808993/","name":"Kim Owen Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0695446/","name":"Dennis A. programme.title: The Dark Tower
The Dark Mile
programme.desc:
The Dark Tower: Directed by Nikolaj Arcel. With Matthew McConaughey, Idris Elba, Tom Taylor, Dennis Haysbert. A boy haunted by visions of a dark tower from a parallel reality teams up with the tower's disillusioned guardian to stop an evil warlock known as the Man in Black who plans to use the boy to destroy the tower and open the gates of Hell." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1648190/","name":"The Dark Tower","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU3MjUwMzQ3MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjcwNjkxMjI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A boy haunted by visions of a dark tower from a parallel reality teams up with the tower's disillusioned guardian to stop an evil warlock known as the Man in Black who plans to use the boy to destroy the tower and open the gates of H","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1648190/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"wileyschmitt"},"dateCreated":"2017-08-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"No Expectations = Enjoyable Experience","reviewBody":"I've been looking forward to seeing this movie for a few years, I've read all the books including the more recent one ('The Wind Thru the Keyhole') and other books that Walter appeared in. It's currently 2017, and anyone who hasn't learned the 'book to movie' lesson by now needs to finally learn it so that they can also enjoy movies what they are, which is an extra bonus for a book that is well liked by a lot of people. If the movie actually turns out good than all the better, but being more realistic about movies not having to live up to the books they're based on is best thing to do so you don't end up like the rest of these bitter people who leave the movie theater as quickly as possible just to come back home and write a 'nerd'tastic negative one starred review expressing all their deep down inner angst in the most pathetic form possible. Luckily I beat many of them to the punch before they tore this fun and entertaining movie apart, and I did find it entertaining thanx to having zero expectations about it, go ahead and try it next time you go to a similar movie, you'll at least temporarily enjoy yourself. Whining and complaining about trivial things isn't good for you or anyone else anyways.

I thought they did a fairly good job considering all the various challenges that this potential movie presented them, and the fact that it at one point seemed like it may never even get released or get just get much further delayed didn't make the project seem as promising as it did when first hearing about it's production a few years back for the first time. I got my expectations up very high when I first heard about it, but as time went on I would settle for just about anything decent, and 'decent' it sure was, though I'll rate the movie a 10 to make up for one or two reviews from the Negative Nancys of IMDb. I'm happy to see that Sony left this open for a sequel, It's still not a for sure thing if they'll make another, though King seems to think they will, but I'd pay a lot of money to see a movie based of the backstory from 'Wizard and Glass'.

Bottom line: Have fun, it's a fun movie whether you have read the books or not. Not a bad choice for the kids either, lot of action, no nudity, and not much cussing from what I recall, (12+ is my guess depending on who you are, ratings can be deceiving).

If you haven't read the books: Read them if you're an avid reader, you won't regret it, but if you're just an average reader then the 8 books will take you far too long to get thru and you'll probably give up and have wasted a lot of time trying. One trick is just to be disciplined enough to read every single day if possible, and it doesn't even have to be much because it will add up over the course of year, and if you were to read 10 - 15 pages per day every day you'd be able to finish 'The Dark Tower' series within one year. (Quick easy formula: 365 days per year, very roughly 365 pages per book, so 5 pages per day will get you thru 5 books per year, and not difficult at all to make that 40 pages per day, and at the end of the year you will have read 40 BOOKS! Probably more books than you've ready in your life, just got to form the habit first and go from there, keep track with a notebook to stay disciplined if you have to). 

Other King suggestions: 'The Shining' Even better than the movie, and possibly underrated because of the movie's popularity, and the fact most people are too lazy to read. 

'The Eyes of the Dragon' Walter is a main character, and King once again digs into the darkness of the man's psyche while weaving a great story in Medieval times. 

'The Stand' The ultimate apocalyptic adventure with Walter doing what he does best, and the fate of the lives of dozens of different characters all linked to Walter thru their dreams of him, and has 1000 or so pages to all find each other and come together to somehow stop him while avoiding much betrayal and many obstacles along the beaten path that is led and aided by their other dreams of another character who is out to help them find where they need to be going. 

'Different Seasons' No, it's not a story about a possessed spice rack) This book includes four novellas (short novels). Most of you will recognize of 2 or 3 of the others as those were all turned into good movies ('The Shawshank Redemption' 'Apt Pupil' and 'The Body' AKA 'Stand By Me'), and just as is usually the case are far superior to the films, and not that the films are bad at all. 

It's just the reality that books always beat movies, it's no contest at all, but movies are a time for us to do something unproductive and be happy while doing it. So don't be like these sad saps who would actually pay for a movie knowing very well that they'll not have a good time. One of the secrets to life is 'to have a good time when you're able to', and if you like to laugh at bad movies that are trying to be serious then you need to finally get yourself on the MST3K and Rifftrax bandwagon.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":134154,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.6},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2017-08-04","keywords":"gunslinger,based on novel,prophetic dream,another world,parallel dimension","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"International Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1690417433","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTkxNTk3NjgxM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTAyMDY4MjI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTkxNTk3NjgxM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTAyMDY4MjI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Gunslinger, Roland Deschain, roams an Old West-like landscape where "the world has moved on" in pursuit of the man in black. Definitely","reviewBody":"First, let me say that I didn't know Dominion existed until I discovered it going through the program guide. I started watching and man was I confused! I though that there was ANOTHER prequel that I didn't know about, until I continued to watch. Dominion seemed to me like a movie made out of pieces of film on the floor of the editing room. Clara Bellar's acting was awful in my opinion. I was completely distracted by her performance as well as several others.

While not a true horror movie, I really enjoyed The Beginning. I've watched it many times and found it very suspenseful. It kept my attention. I enjoyed the actors and the story. I've watched it over ten times and the scenes where Father M had to choose those to die? Chilling. Who wouldn't lose faith? The boy being torn apart? There were some good scenes.

The main reason I didn't like this film is the lousy acting.

When the mayor's cousin is murdered, a deputy DA (Bergin) whose reputation has suffered in a previous case is assigned to investigate the murder. The cousin's wife is the beautiful, sexy, body to die for Joan Severance, so we can see what's coming. Meanwhile, his partner (Roy) doesn't like the way he's handling the case and seems jealous of the wife, who is the obvious suspect.

I just couldn't get into this. It looked cheap and some of the acting was horrendous.

A deputy-district attorney, assigned to investigate the murder of the mayor's cousin, finds himself falling for the victim's wife." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0212048/","name":"Cause of Death","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYzOTg1ODIzOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzEyNTgwMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A deputy-district attorney, assigned to investigate the murder of the mayor's cousin, finds himself falling for the victim's wife.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0212048/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"blanche-2","dateCreated":"2014-02-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"skip it","reviewBody":"Patrick Bergin, Michael Ironside, Maxim Roy, and Joan Severance star in "Cause of Death," a film from 2001.

The main reason I didn't like this film is the lousy acting.

When the mayor's cousin is murdered, a deputy DA (Bergin) whose reputation has suffered in a previous case is assigned to investigate the murder. The cousin's wife is the beautiful, sexy, body to die for Joan Severance, so we can see what's coming. Meanwhile, his partner (Roy) doesn't like the way he's handling the case and seems jealous of the wife, who is the obvious suspect.

I just couldn't get into this. It looked cheap and some of the acting was horrendous.

Left me cold.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":3,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":309,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.4,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Mystery","Romance"],"datePublished":"2001-01-10","keywords":"murder,video tape,trial,swimming pool,political corruption","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000920/","name":"Patrick Bergin","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0747114/","name":"Maxim Roy","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000220/","name":"Joan Severance"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0340244/","name":"Marc S. programme.title: Remember Me
Twój na zawsze
Remember Me
programme.desc:
Remember Me: Directed by Allen Coulter. With Caitlyn Rund, Moisés Acevedo, Noel Rodriguez, Kevin P. McCarthy. A romantic drama centered on two new lovers: Tyler, whose parents have split in the wake of his brother's suicide, and Ally, who lives each day to the fullest since witnessing her mother's murder." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1403981/","name":"Remember Me","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTA4MTg1ODkwNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzE5ODAxMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A romantic drama centered on two new lovers: Tyler, whose parents have split in the wake of his brother's suicide, and Ally, who lives each day to the fullest since witnessing her mother's murder.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1403981/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Southerngiftsu"},"dateCreated":"2010-03-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"Same movie as pro critics?","reviewBody":"I walked away from the movie, Remember Me, asking myself one question. Did I just see the same movie I have heard several professional movie critics review negatively or indifferently? The first review I read online for Remember Me was that it was trite, predictable, and drawn out. (Bull, I say.) The responses of those around me in the theater today proved those claims false as well. I saw people laughing, gasping, wincing, and weeping. I saw the audience RELATING.

The characters are multi-dimensional and the acting is fantastic. This movie was not just feel-good fluff. It was not a platform to showcase Brosnan and Pattinson as eye candy. It was thought-provoking and intense. The characters were brooding, wounded, lovable and believable. The movie's twist was unique and effective.

If you want to see an enjoyable movie that will challenge your emotions and leave you feeling appropriately introspective, Remember Me fits the bills perfectly. (And there is nothing at all wrong with the added eye-candy benefit! ;)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":142953,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2010-03-31","keywords":"new york,new york city,binge drinking,september 11 2001,year 1991","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1472839961","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGJlMTgxMGMtZWE5NC00NjA1LWEzNTgtMmVhZGZjNTY0MzNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGJlMTgxMGMtZWE5NC00NjA1LWEzNTgtMmVhZGZjNTY0MzNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1500155/","name":"Robert Pattinson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0211087/","name":"Emilie de Ravin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3533310/","name":"Caitlyn Rund"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002339/","name":"Allen Coulter"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046206/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3391497/","name":"Will Fetters"}],"duration":"PT1H53M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Diabolique
Diabolique
programme.desc:
Diabolique: Directed by Jeremiah S. Chechik. With Sharon Stone, Isabelle Adjani, Chazz Palminteri, Kathy Bates. The wife and mistress of the sadistic dean of an exclusive prep school conspire to murder him." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0116095/","name":"Diabolique","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmFmOWRkZWEtYWZlNC00MDQyLWFlODAtODdjNzU5MzY5ZGE3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The wife and mistress of the sadistic dean of an exclusive prep school conspire to murder him.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0116095/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"JamesHitchcock"},"dateCreated":"2005-04-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"My Attention Was Glued to my Watch","reviewBody":"Oscar Wilde was one of the great wits of his age, but he was allegedly not averse to appropriating other people's bons mots. It is said that after his friend and rival James Whistler had made a particularly apposite remark, Wilde sighed and said "I wish I had said that!". Whistler's reply was "You will, Oscar, you will". The American film industry has a similar attitude to other people's films to the one that Wilde had to other people's conversation. When the European- particularly the British or French- film industry comes up with a particularly admired film, Hollywood gives a collective sigh and says "We wish we had made that!" You will, Hollywood, you will!

Recent years have seen a glut of remakes of European films, but, admittedly, the results of this creative plagiarism are by no means always bad. The plot of "Sommersby" may have been blatantly lifted from "Le Retour de Martin Guerre", but it is still a good film in its own right. Moreover, I was one of those who thought that Luc Besson's "Nikita" did not lose much in translation when it was remade as the Bridget Fonda vehicle "The Assassin". Sometimes, however, Hollywood manages to come up with a remake that is so inferior to its original model that the two films do not deserve to be mentioned in the same breath. "Diabolique" is a case in point.

Henri-Georges Clouzot's "Les Diaboliques" was one of the classic thrillers of the fifties, as good as the best of Hitchcock's work. Jeremiah Chechik's remake borrows the same basic plot of the original, but transfers it from 1950s France to 1990s America. At the centre is the sadistic headmaster of a private school, a man who brutally mistreats not only the boys in his care but also his wife and even his beautiful mistress. The wife and mistress,tired of his mistreatment, plot together to murder him and to dispose of his body in the filthy school swimming pool, but when the pool is later drained the body has disappeared. As in the original, there is a sudden, surprise twist at the end. Chechik also, however,introduces elements that were not in Clouzot's film. The wife, Mia, here becomes a former nun, who has renounced her vows after losing her faith, but is still haunted by guilt. There is a suggestion of a lesbian relationship between Mia and the mistress, Nicole. Chechik also introduces a major character, in the form of a female detective, with no equivalent in the original film.

"Diabolique" has come in for some sharp criticism, largely because it is a remake of a classic. It is a mediocre film rather than a horrendously bad one, and if we did not have its famous predecessor to compare it with, it would doubtless be seen as just another banal and unsuccessful crime thriller. Nevertheless, I think that the criticism it has attracted is justified. Chechik must have known that one of the perils of remaking a film is that your work will be weighed in the balance against the original, and woe betide you if it is found wanting. And, compared with Clouzot's, Chechik's film is wanting indeed. He lacks the French director's sense of pacing and ability to convey suspense, with the result that his film is slow-moving where the original was brisk and flabby where the original was taut.

I was also disappointed by the acting. Isabelle Adjani can be a fine actress in her own language, as she showed in "La Reine Margot", but I have not been impressed with her in English-language films, and here her character never came to life. Sharon Stone was slightly better as the hard-bitten, sluttish Nicole, but this was not really one of her better performances and did nothing to alter my view that she has not always chosen the best vehicles in which to show off her talents. Chazz Palminteri's headmaster was almost too unpleasant to be believable, and Kathy Bates seemed wasted as the detective. Watching Clouzot's film I was glued to the screen with anticipation as I wondered how the film would end; watching Chechik's, my attention was rather glued to my watch as I wondered when it would end. 4/10","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":14083,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.5},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Horror","Mystery"],"datePublished":"1996-10-28","keywords":"stockings,woman on top,dead body in a bathtub,dead body in a car,death in a bathtub","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Diabolique","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi950141209","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTQ5ZWE4MTAtZjFlNi00MjZhLWFhNGUtMzcwZDlmZjIwODY3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTQ5ZWE4MTAtZjFlNi00MjZhLWFhNGUtMzcwZDlmZjIwODY3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Warner Home Video"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000232/","name":"Sharon Stone"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000254/","name":"Isabelle Adjani"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001590/","name":"Chazz Palminteri"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0154819/","name":"Jeremiah S. Chechik"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033326/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0027919/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033472/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0092267/","name":"Pierre Boileau"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0092268/","name":"Thomas Narcejac"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0167241/","name":"Henri-Georges Clouzot"}],"duration":"PT1H47M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Dead Man's Shoes
Buty nieboszczyka
Dead Man's Shoes
programme.desc: Dead Man's Shoes: Directed by Shane Meadows. With Paddy Considine, Gary Stretch, Toby Kebbell, Stuart Wolfenden. A disaffected soldier returns to his hometown to get even with the thugs who brutalized his mentally-challenged brother years ago." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0419677/","name":"Dead Man's Shoes","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI5Mzk1MDc2M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjIzMDA0MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A disaffected soldier returns to his hometown to get even with the thugs who brutalized his mentally-challenged brother years ago.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0419677/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"CalRhys"},"dateCreated":"2014-09-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Powerful And Emotionally-Striking Low-Budget Masterpiece","reviewBody":"One of the most effective and emotionally-striking films to have come out of Britain in the last decade, talented indie auteur Shane Meadows has created another masterpiece with 'Dead Man's Shoes'. A gritty and unsettling tale of revenge set amidst a small Northern England town rife with small-time drug dealers and criminals. 'Dead Man's Shoes' truly shows Paddy Considine's acting talent as the grief-stricken brother who has returned home to settle the score with the guys who brutalised his simple-minded brother and sent him into a life of chaos. This is truly a powerful and emotional tale that I cannot get out of my head, one that lingers in your mind. A film definitely to be watched (if you can handle the depressing tone), Shane Meadows has created an utter masterpiece of British cinema."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":52016,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2004-10-01","keywords":"revenge,torture,army veteran,anger,brother brother relationship","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Dead Man's Shoes","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi950075673","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTk5NjQ3M2YtOGY1My00NTdkLWE5ZGEtZGI3NzFjOTU5NmExXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTk5NjQ3M2YtOGY1My00NTdkLWE5ZGEtZGI3NzFjOTU5NmExXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Magnolia Pictures"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0175916/","name":"Paddy Considine"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0834282/","name":"Gary Stretch"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1527905/","name":"Toby Kebbell"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0276349/","name":"Shane Meadows"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0104859/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0135852/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0091923/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0175916/","name":"Paddy Considine"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0276349/","name":"Shane Meadows"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0292211/","name":"Paul Fraser"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0419677, Title: Dead Man's Shoes, --- Description: Dead Man's Shoes: Directed by Shane Meadows. With Paddy Considine, Gary Stretch, Toby Kebbell, Stuart Wolfenden. A disaffected soldier returns to his hometown to get even with the thugs who brutalized his mentally-challenged brother years ago." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0419677/","name":"Dead Man's Shoes","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI5Mzk1MDc2M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjIzMDA0MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A disaffected soldier returns to his hometown to get even with the thugs who brutalized his mentally-challenged brother years ago.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0419677/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"CalRhys","dateCreated":"2014-09-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Powerful And Emotionally-Striking Low-Budget Masterpiece","reviewBody":"One of the most effective and emotionally-striking films to have come out of Britain in the last decade, talented indie auteur Shane Meadows has created another masterpiece with 'Dead Man's Shoes'. A gritty and unsettling tale of revenge set amidst a small Northern England town rife with small-time drug dealers and criminals. 'Dead Man's Shoes' truly shows Paddy Considine's acting talent as the grief-stricken brother who has returned home to settle the score with the guys who brutalised his simple-minded brother and sent him into a life of chaos. This is truly a powerful and emotional tale that I cannot get out of my head, one that lingers in your mind. A film definitely to be watched (if you can handle the depressing tone), Shane Meadows has created an utter masterpiece of British cinema.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":52016,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6,"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2004-10-01","keywords":"revenge,torture,army veteran,anger,brother brother relationship","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Dead Man's Shoes","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi950075673","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTk5NjQ3M2YtOGY1My00NTdkLWE5ZGEtZGI3NzFjOTU5NmExXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTk5NjQ3M2YtOGY1My00NTdkLWE5ZGEtZGI3NzFjOTU5NmExXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Magnolia Pictures","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0175916/","name":"Paddy Considine","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0834282/","name":"Gary Stretch","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1527905/","name":"Toby Kebbell"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0276349/","name":"Shane Meadows"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0104859/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0135852/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0091923/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0175916/","name":"Paddy Considine","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0276349/","name":"Shane Meadows","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0292211/","name":"Paul Fraser"],"duration":"PT1H30M"</script><metacontent="
